page.title: 10The Remarkable Mr. Foggit
page.content:
Mr. Foggit, aged 72, keeps weather records as did his father and grandfather. He relies on nature, a barometer, and his records to forecast the weather. For years he has written a weather column in the newspaper. He is interviewed on TV. He also records a message for British Telecom's 'Dial the Weather'. He observes animal and plant behaviour, knowing that in fine weather swallows fly high for insect food, spiders spin long threads, certain flowers open and cows are spaced about the field.
{Mr. Foggit by Zoe Marshman} He forecasts weather in his old age Not by satellite or a gauge He uses nature for his source Flowers like chickweed,hawkweed,gorse, You see all close when things look wet Mr. Foggit's our local Met.
